This application is designed to facilitate the consensual forensic analysis of Android devices, for the purpose of identifying traces of compromise of sophisticated mobile spyware attacks. 

 After the analysis, you can share an encrypted copy of the results with trusted third parties. 
 Beware that the results could in some cases contain sensitive information, so be careful with the sharing.
Connect to a Trusted Wi‑Fi Network
To continue, connect your device to a protected Wi‑Fi network, such as your home network or a personal hotspot.

To use this app, you need to enable Notification Permissions in your device settings. \n\n The application will show a notification to allow you to enter the pairing code to pair through ADB Wireless Debugging.

To use this app, you need to enable Developer Options in your device settings. \n\n The application will scan you device using ADB Wireless Debugging, available only when the Developer Options are enabled.
Enable Wireless Debugging and Pair the Application

To use this app, you need to be connected to a Wi-Fi network and pair through the ADB Wireless Debugging feature. \n\n Enable ADB Wireless Debugging, click \"Pair device with pairing code\" and enter the code in the Bugbane notification.
You\'re all set! The app is ready to use with all the latest Android development features. \n\n You can now start the scan and share the results with trusted third parties.
After every scan, it is recommended to disable the Development Option until the next scan.
Configure your app preferences and settings here.
It is recommended to disable the Development Options after every scan and re-enable it when needed to prevent unnecessary use.
